readline: Biblioteca de linha de Leitura GNU
rfkill: Tool for enabling and disabling wireless devices
rpcbind: portmap replacement which supports RPC over various protocols
run-parts: run scripts or programs in a directory
r: Language and environment for statistical computing and graphics
raptor: A C library that parses RDF/XML/N-Triples into RDF triples
rarian: Documentation meta-data library, designed as a replacement for Scrollkeeper.
rasqal: A free C library that handles Resource Description Framework (RDF) query syntaxes, query construction and query execution returning result bindings
razor: A distributed, collaborative, spam detection and filtering network
rcs: Revision Control System: manages multiple revisions of files
re2c: A tool for generating C-based recognizers from regular expressions
recode: Converts files between various character sets and usages
redland: Library that provides a high-level interface to RDF data
refind-efi: Rod Smith's fork of rEFIt UEFI Boot Manager - Built with GNU-EFI libs
rest: A helper library for RESTful services.
rp-pppoe: Roaring Penguin's Point-to-Point Protocol over Ethernet client
rsync: A file transfer program to keep remote files in sync
rubberband: Time-stretching and pitch-shifting audio library and utility
ruby: An object-oriented language for quick and easy programming
rygel: UPnP AV MediaServer and MediaRenderer that allows you to easily share audio, video and pictures, and control of media player on your home network
rhino: Open-source implementation of JavaScript written entirely in Java
rhino-javadoc: Open-source implementation of JavaScript written entirely in Java - Javadoc
rpmextract: Script to convert or extract RPM archives (contains rpm2cpio)
r128-dri: Mesa DRI drivers for ATI Rage128
r8168: A kernel module for Realtek 8168 network cards
r8168-lts: A kernel module for Realtek 8168 network cards for linux-lts
racket: A full-spectrum language with DrRacket IDE. Formerly known as PLT Scheme.
racket-docs: Docs for the full-spectrum language formerly known as PLT Scheme.
radare2: Open-source tools to disasm, debug, analyze and manipulate binary files
radeontool: Lowlevel tools to tweak register and dump state on radeon GPUs
ragel: Compiles finite state machines from regular languages into executable C, C++, Objective-C, or D code.
rankwidth: A program that calculates rank-width and rank-decompositions
rapidsvn: A cross-platform GUI front-end for the Subversion revision system written in C++ using the wxWidgets framework.
ratpoints: A program that uses an optimized quadratic sieve algorithm in order to find rational points on hyperelliptic curves
raw-thumbnailer: A lightweight and fast raw image thumbnailer that can be used by file managers.
rawstudio: An open source raw-image converter written in GTK+
rclone: Sync files to and from Google Drive, S3, Swift, Cloudfiles, Dropbox and Google Cloud Storage
rdesktop: An open source client for Windows Remote Desktop Services
rdiff-backup: A utility for local/remote mirroring and incremental backups.
re2: C++ library for fast, safe, thread-friendly alternative to backtracking regular expression engines like those used in PCRE, Perl, and Python
read-edid: Program that can get information from a PNP monitor
reaver: Brute force attack against Wifi Protected Setup
recoll: Full text search tool based on Xapian backend
recorditnow: A plugin based desktop recorder for KDE SC 4
recordmydesktop: Produces a OGG encapsulated Theora/Vorbis recording of your desktop
recoverdm: helps to recover disks with bad sectors
redshift: Adjusts the color temperature of your screen according to your surroundings.
regexxer: Interactive search and replace tool for GNOME
rekonq: A WebKit based web browser for KDE
remind: A sophisticated calendar and alarm program.
remmina: remote desktop client written in GTK+
renameutils: A set of programs designed to make renaming of files faster and less cumbersome
repo: The Multiple Git Repository Tool from the Android Open Source Project
reptyr: Utility for taking an existing running program and attaching it to a new terminal
rethinkdb: Distributed powerful and scalable NoSQL database
retroarch: Reference frontend for the libretro API
rev-plugins: LADSPA stereo and ambisonic reverb plugin based on zita-rev1
rftg: Singleplayer and online implementation of the card game Race for the Galaxy by Tom Lehman.
rhash: Utility for verifying hash sums of files
ripperx: GTK program to rip and encode mp3 files
ristretto: Fast and lightweight picture-viewer for Xfce
rlog: A flexible message logging facility for C++ programs and libraries
rlwrap: Adds readline-style editing and history to programs.
rmlint: Tool to remove duplicates and other lint, being much faster than fdupes
rocksndiamonds: game similiar to Boulderdash with lots of levels
rofi: Popup window switcher roughly based on superswitcher, requiring only xlib and xft
rox: A small and fast file manager which can optionally manage the desktop background and panels
rpc2: Remote procedure call package for IP/UDP
rsibreak: Takes care of your health and regularly breaks your work to avoid repetitive strain injury (RSI)
rss-glx: The Really Slick Screensavers port to GLX
rsyslog: An enhanced multi-threaded syslogd with a focus on security and reliability
rtl-sdr: Driver for Realtek RTL2832U, allowing general purpose software defined radio (SDR).
rtorrent: Ncurses BitTorrent client based on libTorrent
rubiks: Several programs for working with Rubik's cubes
ruby-atk: Ruby/ATK is a Ruby binding of ATK-1.0.x.
ruby-gdk_pixbuf2: Ruby/GdkPixbuf2 is a Ruby binding of GdkPixbuf-2.x.
ruby-gio2: Ruby/GIO2 is a Ruby binding of gio-2.x.
ruby-glib2: Ruby/GLib2 is a Ruby binding of GLib-2.x.
ruby-gobject-introspection: Ruby/GObjectIntrospection is a Ruby binding of GObjectIntrospection.
ruby-gtk2: Ruby/GTK2 is a Ruby binding of GTK+-2.x.
ruby-hpricot: A swift, liberal HTML parser with a fantastic library
ruby-ncurses: Module for interactive text console applications (ncurses)
ruby-pango: Ruby/Pango is a Ruby binding of pango-1.x.
ruby-rdiscount: Fast Implementation of Gruber's Markdown in C
rust: Systems programming language focused on safety, speed and concurrency
rust-docs: Systems programming language focused on safety, speed and concurrency
rxvt-unicode: A unicode enabled rxvt-clone terminal emulator (urxvt)
rabbitmq: Highly reliable and performant enterprise messaging implementation of AMQP written in Erlang/OTP
rawdog: RSS Aggregator Without Delusions Of Grandeur
rebar: A sophisticated build-tool for Erlang projects that follows OTP principles.
reflector: A Python 3 module and script to retrieve and filter the latest Pacman mirror list.
retext: A simple editor for Markdown and ReStructuredText markup languages
rkhunter: Checks machines for the presence of rootkits and other unwanted tools.
ropper: Show information about binary files and find gadgets to build rop chains for different architectures
rox-lib: Shared code which can be used by other ROX applications. This is rox-lib2
rubber: A wrapper for LaTeX and friends
rubinius: Ruby runtime written in Ruby, designed for concurrency
ruby-bundler: Manages an application's dependencies through its entire life, across many machines, systematically and repeatably.
ruby-dbus: Ruby module for interaction with D-Bus
ruby-diff-lcs: Diff::LCS computes the difference between two Enumerable sequences using the McIlroy-Hunt longest common subsequence (LCS) algorithm
ruby-mime-types-data: provides a registry for information about MIME media type definitions
ruby-mustache: Mustache is a framework-agnostic way to render logic-free views.
ruby-paint: Ruby paint manages terminal colors and effects
ruby-polyglot: Allows custom language loaders to be hooked into require
ruby-rack: Rack provides minimal, modular and adaptable interface for developing web applications in Ruby
ruby-rainbow: Rainbow is extension to ruby's String class adding support for colorizing text on ANSI terminal
ruby-ronn: Manual page formatter that generates man pages from markdown
ruby-rspec: RSpec meta-gem that depends on the other components
ruby-rspec-expectations: Provides a readable API to express expected outcomes of a code example
ruby-rspec-mocks: RSpecs 'test double' framework, with support for stubbing and mocking
ruby-rspec-support: Common code needed by the other RSpec gems. Not intended for direct use
ruby-term-ansicolor: A ruby library that colors strings using ANSI escape sequences
ruby-tins: All the stuff that is not good/big enough for a real library
ruby-treetop: A Ruby-based text parsing and interpretation DSL
ruby-trollop: Commandline option parser for Ruby that just gets out of your way
runc: CLI tool for managing OCI compliant containers
